citations.narrative:
The plastic kiddie pool for two adult Muscovy ducks had inadequate water depth and surface area for both animals to
express natural behaviors such as bathing, swimming and paddling. The pool was located on an uneven surface and
appeared to be 1/3 full causing the water to collect on one side and leaving the elevated surface minimally covered with
water. Failure to provide a pool or other aquatic area of sufficient surface area and depth for all aquatic birds in the
enclosure to be able to express natural behaviors can lead to increased stress and a decline in physical condition.
Primary enclosures housing wading and aquatic birds must contain a pool or other aquatic area and a dry area that allows
easy ingress or egress of the pool or other aquatic area. Pools and other aquatic areas must be of sufficient surface area
and depth to allow each bird to make normal postural and social adjustments, such as immersion, bathing, swimming and
foraging.
Correct by 4 October 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
A developed and documented environment enhancement plan for birds was not available for review at time of inspection.
Failure to create and follow an environment enhancement plan can lead to poor health and psychological welfare of birds.
A species-appropriate plan for environment enhancement is required to be developed, documented and followed in order
to promote the psychological well-being of birds.
Correct by 20 October 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.153(c) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The plastic kiddie pool for two adult Muscovy ducks had inadequate water depth and surface area for both animals to 
express natural behaviors such as bathing, swimming and paddling. The pool was located on an uneven surface and 
appeared to be 1/3 full causing the water to collect on one side and leaving the elevated surface minimally covered with 
water. Failure to provide a pool or other aquatic area of sufficient surface area and depth for all aquatic birds in the 
enclosure to be able to express natural behaviors can lead to increased stress and a decline in physical condition. 
Primary enclosures housing wading and aquatic birds must contain a pool or other aquatic area and a dry area that allows 
easy ingress or egress of the pool or other aquatic area. Pools and other aquatic areas must be of sufficient surface area 
and depth to allow each bird to make normal postural and social adjustments, such as immersion, bathing, swimming and 
foraging.  
 
Correct by 4 October 2023. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
A developed and documented environment enhancement plan for birds was not available for review at time of inspection. 
Failure to create and follow an environment enhancement plan can lead to poor health and psychological welfare of birds. 
A species-appropriate plan for environment enhancement is required to be developed, documented and followed in order 
to promote the psychological well-being of birds. 
 
Correct by 20 October 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
